definitions.body: :Es 3:15 decree, law, usage, only in Persian period (BAram. NH id., Syr. dato0 or doto0; Pers. loan-w., Old Pers. dâta, law, Spieg:APK 225)—´[[ד]] abs. Es 1:8 + 9 t.; cstr. [[דַּת]] Es 2:12, [[דָּת]] Es 9:13; sf. [[דָּתוֹ]] Es 2:8 + 4 t.; pl. cstr. [[דָּתֵי]] Ezr 8:36 + 2 t.; sf. [[דָּתַיהֶם]] Es 3:8; —

decree, edict, commission of Pers. king Ezr 8:36 (word elsewhere only in Est) Es 2:8 (‖[[דְּבַר הַמֶּלֶךְ]]), Es 4:3 (‖ id.) Es 8:17 (‖ id.) Es 9:1 (‖ id.; c. [[עשׂה]] execute) cf. also Es 9:13; c. vb. [[נׇתַן]] Es 3:14, Es 3:15, Es 8:13, Es 8:14, Es 9:14; written [[כְּתָב־הַדָּת]] Es 4:8 (cf. Es 3:14, Es 8:13).

law, permanently valid and applicable, [[וְיִכָּתֵב בְּדָתֵי פָּרַסאוּמָדַי וְלאׁ יַעֲבוֹר]] Es 1:19 cf. v:Es 1:15, Es 4:11, Es 4:16; [[יׁדְעֵי דָּת וׇדִין]] Es 1:13 those that understood law and judgment; [[דָּתֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ]] Es 3:8; of laws of the Jews in Persia Es 3:8; even of rules for drinking at a feast Es 1:8; for purifying of women Es 2:12.—The distinction between

is not absolute. The king's will was law, and the royal edict ([[דְּבַר מַלְכוּת]]) concerning Vashti was reckoned among the laws ([[דָּתֵי]]) of the Persians & Medes (Es 1:19).—In De 33:2 MT [[אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ]] fire was a law for them is corrupt; many emend. proposed, cf. Di; Di suggests [[דׂת]][[[לַפִּ]]][[אֵשׁ ]] fire of flames, flaming fire, cf. [[הַלַּפִּידִם]] Ex 20:18 (but [[לַפִּדׂת]] pl. in [[ת]]—[[ׂ]] not in OT unless as n.pr.), or (better), [[דֶת]][[[יׁקֶ]]][[אֵשׁ ]] a burning fire, cf. Is 65:5 (diff. sense).
